DataElement.preferredName: Multidimensional Fatigue Inventory Total Reduced Motivation Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the total reduced motivation dimension score for the Multidimensional Fatigue Inventory.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Multidimensional Fatigue Inventory Total Reduced Motivation Dimension Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 20-item self-report instrument designed to measure fatigue. It covers the following dimensions: General Fatigue, Physical Fatigue, Mental Fatigue, Reduced Motivation and Reduced Activity._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._A dimension of reduced motivation in the Multidimensional Fatigue Inventory._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 20-item self-report instrument designed to measure fatigue. It covers the following dimensions: General Fatigue, Physical Fatigue, Mental Fatigue, Reduced Motivation and Reduced Activity.

Concepts.definition: A 20-item self-report instrument designed to measure fatigue. It covers the following dimensions: General Fatigue, Physical Fatigue, Mental Fatigue, Reduced Motivation and Reduced Activity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Assessment of psychological variables by the application of mathematical procedures.:A number with no fractional part.::two:A single character in a numbering system.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The science of measuring "psychological" aspects of a person such as knowledge, skills, abilities, or personality. Measurement of these unobservable phenomena is difficult and much of the research and accumulated art of this discipline is designed to reliably define and then quantify.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A single character in a numbering system.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
